title: Mojeek, Why The Name? How Do You Say It?

summary: When I moved back to North Carolina in 2005, I sat down with my grandmother and asked her about my family.  I come from a mountain family that is very tight-lipped about family secrets, and I wanted to know the juicy stuff.  So, for a few hours, we sat down, and she spilled it all...
title: Things I Wish I Would Have Asked My Grandmother

summary: The project, the painting, the song, the website, the meal or sketch or repair or essay, the book, the garden, the hobby, the app, the collage, the game… whatever little
title: Start the thing

summary:
In all the hubbub back in September wondering how Apple was going to advertise its new iPhones with Apple Intelligence when Apple Intelligence wasn’t even shipping on the new iPhones yet, I don’t recall anyone speculating how Apple Intelligence itself would be advertised.  Well, we have our answer, and it’s not great. 
From the first Apple Intelligence ad, something didn’t sit right with me...
title: Apple is straight-up telling us to lie

summary: Microsoft today released updates to plug at least 89 security holes in its Windows operating systems and other software.  November's patch batch includes fixes for two zero-day vulnerabilities that are already being exploited by attackers, as well as two other flaws that were publicly disclosed prior to today
title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday, November 2024 Edition

summary:
Andrew Liszewski, theverge. com:

An Italian startup called Artinoise has created an unusual USB-C accessory for mobile devices that turns them into playable musical instruments.  The Zefiro looks like a flash drive or a tiny vape, but by gently blowing into one end, it can be used to play simulated instruments with even less skill than what was needed to play those plastic recorders in grade school...
title: Artinoise Makes a Hardware Version of Smule’s Ocarina (Yes, the app from 2008)

summary: Hey, Miraz I was thinking of you last night as me and mine watched a couple of new shows over on Acorn TV.  The Whistable Pearl and a new one to me, DCI Ellis.  Both UK made and based...

I've been in a bit of a writing slump lately, and I can say without a shred of doubt that this slump is going to be here for a while.  I don't know if you all know this, but, even though I live in Chicago, I'm not American.  I come from South America, and the person who was elected president of the United States made it very clear that people like me are not really welcome around these parts...
title: Take care of yourself

summary:
One of my first requests for Bear, about two years ago, was for an archive feature.  There still isn't one, but I had an idea when I read today that Herman added filtering by multiple tags. 
I thought it would work well to create a nice blog archive...
title: Creating a Bear Blog Archive

summary: Resolve the friction between dev and security teams with platform-led workflows that make cloud security seamless and scalable
title: Fix the developers vs. security conflict by shifting further left
